ngiemboon: Shÿefatiya míŋ Mataŋ wembàŋa, lâ Ngendalia míŋ Pashÿegu wembàŋa, mbɔɔ Yukâa míŋ Shÿelemiya wembàŋa, ńgÿo Pashÿegu míŋ Malekiya wembàŋa, pɔ́ la júʼ menò ntsèm mie Yelemî la gíŋe ńne ńgɔɔn mbwó láʼ ngie:
en: Now Shephatiah son of Mattan, Gedaliah son of Pashhur, Jucal   son of Shelemiah,  # 38:1 Jr 37:3 and Pashhur son of Malchijah heard the words Jeremiah was speaking to all the people:

ngiemboon: Cʉ̀apʉ̀a ne ńgɔɔn ngie: «Nyìŋ gẅie à ge láʼ zso tsɛ̀ɛ yɔɔn tÿǒsoŋ, à lɔɔn ńdáʼ te kwé ncù wɔ́, ńké te kwé nzyè wɔ́, mbà à ge kwé gwáʼa. Táʼ, nyìŋ gẅie à ge gÿo fó tÿǒsoŋ, é kÿo gʉa né Mbambilonia, zɔ ge gÿo tsẅɛ́. Mé té gÿo zẅé yé wɔ́.»
en: “This is what the Lord says: ‘Whoever stays in this city will die by the sword, famine, and plague,   but whoever surrenders to the Chaldeans will live.  # 38:2 Jr 21:9; 38:17–21 He will retain his life like the spoils of war and will live.’  # 38:2 Jr 21:9; 39:18; 45:5

ngiemboon: Cʉ̀apʉ̀a gǐŋ ne ńgɔɔn ngie: «N ge gÿo kwaʼ sẅéen yɔɔn tÿǒsoŋ ŋwɛ́, ńná né katúʼu fùɔ Mbambilonia, à kwaʼ ńkẅé.»
en: This is what the Lord says: ‘This city will most certainly be handed over to the king of Babylon’s army,   and he will capture it.’ ”

ngiemboon: Á la cʉa púʼu, meŋwǎláʼ gɔɔn né fùɔ Sendesíasè ngie: «Shúshu, á ne ńzɛ́te ngie Yelemî kwé! Ńtí nue yé zɔ pǔ ḿmaʼa kwɔ̀gmetsẅiŋ, á na katúʼ, tà mbɔɔ na pʉ̀a pie é nyé ńgwɔ́ tsɛ̀ɛ tÿǒsoŋ. Andÿò wɔɔn ŋwɛ́ te ne faʼa nò mbòŋo na láʼ wɔ́, à faʼa pɔ́ nò tepòŋ.»
en: The officials then said to the king, “This man ought to die, because he is weakening the morale   of the warriors who remain in this city and of all the people by speaking to them in this way. This man is not pursuing the welfare of this people, but their harm.”  # 38:4 Jr 29:11

ngiemboon: Ńgɔɔn púʼu, afùɔ Sendesíasè leen ńké ńtsɔ́ʼ ngie: «Pi gÿo mmó gie pi kwǒŋ, á na yé, n tsɛ ńgwɔ́ fùɔ táʼ, ngwɔ́ ń de tɔʼɔ gẅí légÿo mmó na yé wɔ́.»
en: King Zedekiah said, “Here he is; he’s in your hands since the king can’t do anything against you.”

ngiemboon: Ńgɔɔn púʼu, meŋwǎláʼ leen ńké ńgwoon Yelemî, ńnéŋe tsɛ̀ɛ tâŋ ntse gẅie aa we Malekia múɔ tɔ́ʼ. Pɔ́ la lɔg nkÿo ésẅíʼi Yelemî ńnéŋe tsɛ̀ɛ tâŋ gẅie à laa tetʉ́a gie mé pyɛ́bɛ. Entse la te tsɛ̀ɛ tâŋ wɔ́; Yelemî meʼe tsɛ̀ɛ tetyɛ̀b gie á laa tsoló.
en: So they took Jeremiah and dropped him into the cistern of Malchiah the king’s son, which was in the guard’s courtyard, lowering Jeremiah with ropes. There was no water in the cistern, only mud, and Jeremiah sank in the mud.

ngiemboon: Atsɔ̌ nyìŋ Etíyopìa gẅie aa ngàŋafàʼ lÿò tsɛ̀ɛ ndá fùɔ, lezíŋ sé gwɔ́ lê Embɛd-Melɛg, á júʼ ngie mé neŋé Yelemî tsɛ̀ɛ tâŋ; ńgwaa júʼ púʼu, afùɔ tyé ncwò nkáʼa Yelúzálèm gẅie mé tóŋo lê ncwò nkáʼa Mbɛŋjÿamɛŋ.
en: But Ebed-melech, a Cushite court official in the king’s palace, heard Jeremiah had been put into the cistern. While the king was sitting at the Benjamin Gate,

ngiemboon: Embɛd-Meleg leen ńké fó ndá nɔʼ, ńkẅɛ ńgʉa ńgyá fùɔ, ńgɔɔn né yé ngie:
en: Ebed-melech went from the king’s palace and spoke to the king:

ngiemboon: «Ankwɔbɔ́, cʉ̀apʉ̀a wɔ̀ɔn, melÿò pɔɔn maʼá Yelemî ntsẅìnkʉ̀ Ssé tsɛ̀ɛ tâŋ ntse, ammó gie pɔ́ gÿǒ, á kaa poŋo! À ge kwé nzyè tsoló, mélàʼmie ammó mpfɛ̌ té nyé ńgwɔ́ tÿǒsoŋ wɔ́.»
en: “My lord the king, these men have been evil in all they have done to the prophet Jeremiah. They have dropped him into the cistern where he will die from hunger, because there is no more bread in the city.”

ngiemboon: Afùɔ leen ńtsẅi né Embɛd-Meleg nyìŋ Etíyopìa ngie: «Lɔg pʉ̀a móm tá ńtó lé jʉʼɔɔn, pi lâ pɔ̌ fó tsɛ̀ɛ tâŋ ntse ńkẅile Yelemî, ntsẅìnkʉ̀ Ssé tà à nyé te kwé.»
en: So the king commanded Ebed-melech, the Cushite, “Take from here thirty men under your authority   and pull the prophet Jeremiah up from the cistern before he dies.”

ngiemboon: Embɛd-Meleg lɔg pʉ̀a móm tá ńtó. Ńgʉa tsɛ̀ɛ nɔʼ, á tsɛ̀ɛ tsɔ̌ lûmndá gẅie mé leʼe shúm fùʼ tsoló. Ńkúu wó, ḿbí mbɔ́ mentsyàg nzsǒ, ńcʉŋe na nkÿo, ńtsege ńná né Yelemî tsɛ̀ɛ tâŋ ntse.
en: So Ebed-melech took the men under his authority   and went to the king’s palace to a place below the storehouse.  # 38:11 Or treasury From there he took old rags and worn-out clothes and lowered them by ropes to Jeremiah in the cistern.

ngiemboon: Embɛd-Meleg, nyìŋ Etíyopìa leen ńké ńgɔɔn né Yelemî ngie: «Shúshu, vɔg sẅeen metsyàg nzsǒ mɛ̂ megabá gù, á jʉʼ gie nkÿo ge cʉa wó.»
en: Ebed-melech the Cushite called down to Jeremiah, “Place these old rags and clothes between your armpits and the ropes.” Jeremiah did this.

ngiemboon: epʉ̀a ŋwɛ́ leen ńké ńdɔg menkÿo fó tsɛ̀ɛ tâŋ ntse éshwoŋo Yelemî ńnáa kwóŋ. Ńgÿo púʼu, Yelemî leen ńké ńcʉ́ʼʉ ńtsẅé pɔ́ tetʉ́a papyɛ́b jʉʼ.
en: They pulled him up with the ropes and lifted him out of the cistern, but he remained in the guard’s courtyard.

ngiemboon: Afùɔ Sendesíasè túm mé gʉa faʼa Yelemî, ntsẅìnkʉ̀ Ssé, pɔ́ yé gʉa ńtyé na ncwò ndá mbɔ́ɔntè yétá we ndá Cʉ̀apʉ̀a. Á gɔɔn né yé ngie: «N gẅiin nò gie n ge zɛ́te gú, te ké ńdÿoon wɔ́ɔn tsɔ́ mmó.»
en: King Zedekiah sent for the prophet Jeremiah and received him at the third entrance of the Lord’s temple. The king said to Jeremiah, “I am going to ask you something; don’t hide anything from me.”

ngiemboon: Yelemî tsɔ́ʼɔ mbwó fùɔ Sendesíasè ngie: «Tà n dɔɔn shwóŋo gú nò nénʉ́, mbà ɔ̀ te gÿo mé zẅé wɔ́ɔn mɔ́ɔ? N dɔɔn ḿbiŋ ńnáa gú ntÿɔgɔ́ mbà ɔ̀ te tÿɔ́gɔ kwò mǒ wɔ́.»
en: Jeremiah replied to Zedekiah, “If I tell you, you will kill me, won’t you? Besides, if I give you advice, you won’t listen to me anyway.”

ngiemboon: Táʼ, afùɔ Sendesíasè shushǔ ńgɔɔn nò mbwó Yelemî tà ńkʉa ngie: «N te gÿo mé zẅé gú wɔ́, é ké le sẅéen gú, ńnáa mbwó pʉ̀a pie é ne faʼa lézẅé gú wɔ́. N tyě páʼɔɔn á mvfò Cʉ̀apʉ̀a gẅie aa ntʉ̀ntʉ̀, á Cʉ̀apʉ̀a gẅie à gÿo pege gwɔ́ wó.»
en: King Zedekiah swore to Jeremiah in private,   “As the Lord lives, who has given us this life,  # 38:16 Is 57:16 I will not kill you or hand you over to these men who intend to take your life.”

ngiemboon: Yelemî leen ńké ńgɔɔn né Sendesíasè ngie: Anò gie Cʉ̀apʉ̀a Ssé gie e piʼi kɔ̀ɔkɔ́ɔ, ńgwɔ́ Ssé pa Ésàlayɛ gɔ̌ɔn, á yɔɔn: «Ɔ̀ lɔɔn ńkẅɛ ńgʉa ńnyɛ mbùm jù mbwó mekěm fùɔ Mbambilonia, mbà ɔ̀ ge tsẅɛ́, atsìŋendá jú tsẅɛ́ yé, mé piŋ le tuɔ tÿǒsoŋo Yelúzálèm wɔ́.
en: Jeremiah therefore said to Zedekiah, “This is what the Lord, the God of Armies, the God of Israel, says: ‘If indeed you surrender to the officials of the king of Babylon,   then you will live, this city will not be burned, and you and your household will survive.

ngiemboon: Táʼ, ńké ńgwɔ́ gie ɔ̀ lɔɔn te kẅɛ, ńgʉa ńnyɛ mbùm jú mbwó mekěm fùɔ Mbambilonia wɔ́, mbà mé ge sẅéen tÿǒsoŋo Yelúzálèm náa mbwó pʉ̀a Mbambilonia, pɔ́ shÿɔ́g mmɔ̌g wó; ńgʉa na gù, mbà ɔ̀ te tsẅɛ́ɛ wɔ́b wɔ́.»
en: But if you do not surrender to the officials of the king of Babylon, then this city will be handed over to the Chaldeans.   They will burn it, and you yourself will not escape from them.’ ”

ngiemboon: Afùɔ Sendesíasè tsɔ́ʼɔ mbwó Yelemî ngie: «N ne ḿbɔ́gɔ pʉ̀a Yúndà pie é ně ńgʉa lékẅɛ́te pʉ̀a Mbambilonia. N ne ḿbɔ́gɔ mé lésẅéen wɔ́ɔn ńnáa mbwó pɔ́b, pɔ́ nyɛɛ wɔ́ɔn ngɔ́ʼ.»
en: But King Zedekiah said to Jeremiah, “I am worried about the Judeans who have defected to the Chaldeans. They may hand me over to the Judeans to abuse me.”

ngiemboon: Táʼ, Yelemî tsɔ́ʼɔ mbwó yé ngie: «Ngǎŋ, mé te sẅéen gú ńná né pɔ́b wɔ́. Ɔ̀ lɔɔn ńgÿo mmó gie Cʉ̀apʉ̀a tsẅǐ né mèŋ ngie ɔ̀ gÿo, mbà tsɔ́ mmó te gÿo gú wɔ́, mbà ɔ̀ ge tsẅɛ́.
en: “They will not hand you over,” Jeremiah replied. “Obey the Lord in what I am telling you, so it may go well for you and you can live.

ngiemboon: Táʼ, ńké ńgwɔ́ gie ɔ̀ lɔɔn ńdʉʼʉ lényɛ mbùm jù mbwó pɔ́b, mbà Cʉ̀apʉ̀a shwóŋo wɔ́ɔn mmó gie á ge cʉate:
en: But if you refuse to surrender, this is the verdict   that the Lord has shown me:

ngiemboon: Mé ge gwoon panzwě ntsèm pie é ka zso tsɛ̀ɛ nɔʼ jú, é lɔg gʉa náa mbwó mekěm fùɔ Mbambilonia. Panzwě ŋwɛ́ ne ńzɔbɔ ńtʉŋe gú ngie:
en: ‘All the women   who remain in the palace of Judah’s king will be brought out to the officials of the king of Babylon and will say to you,  # 38:22 to you supplied for clarity

ngiemboon: Oon, mé ge gÿo gwoon mezwě pú, pâ gubé jú yembàŋa, é gʉa náa mbwó pʉ̀a Mbambilonia, kwaʼ gù jú, ɔ̀ ké le wɔ́b tsẅɛ́. Afùɔ Mbambilonia ge gÿo lɔgɔ gú gÿo ngàŋatsǎŋ, é piŋ shÿɔ́g mmɔ̌g na tÿǒsoŋo Yelúzálèm.»
en: All your wives and children will be brought out to the Chaldeans.   You yourself will not escape from them, for you will be seized by the king of Babylon and this city will burn.’ ”

ngiemboon: Sendesíasè gɔɔn né Yelemî ngie: Ɔ̀ lɔɔn te ne ńtsɔ́ɔn lékwé wɔ́, ɔ̀ pɔ́ɔn légÿo tà nyìŋ júʼu féfÿɔ́g na nò gie pɔ́gɔ shwǒŋ lɔɔn.
en: Then Zedekiah warned Jeremiah, “Don’t let anyone know about this conversation   or you will die.

ngiemboon: Á ge gǎa wɔ́ɔ, mekěm zsé ngie pɔ̀gɔ shwóŋe, pɔ́ ge zɛ́te gú mmó gie pɔ̀gɔ kɔʼɔ́ éshwóŋe mǒ. Pɔ́ ge gɔɔn né gù ngie: Ɔ̀ lɔɔn te lÿoon wég tsɔ́ mmó wɔ́, mbà peg te zẅé gú wɔ́.
en: The officials may hear that I have spoken with you   and come and demand of you, ‘Tell us what you said to the king; don’t hide anything from us and we won’t kill you. Also, what did the king say to you? ’

ngiemboon: Táʼ, ɔ̀ ge tsɔ́ʼɔ mbwó pɔ́b ngie: «N ka ne sẅíŋte fùɔ ngie à pɔ́ɔn légíŋe ḿbiŋe wɔ́ɔn ńnáa ndá Jÿonataŋ, ḿbɔ́gɔ wɔ́ɔn lékúu wó ńkwé.»
en: If they do, tell them, ‘I was bringing before the king my petition that he not return me to the house of Jonathan to die there.’ ”

ngiemboon: Mekěm ntsèm la tó ńgyá Yelemî, ńzɛ́te yé menò. Táʼ, Yelemî ké ńtsɔ́ʼ pɔ́ páʼ fùɔ ně ńtsẅi púʼu. Á cʉa púʼu, pɔ́ pʉ́le ńnyé yé, ńtí nue nyìŋ la te júʼ páʼ pâ pɔ̌ shwóŋe wɔ́.
en: All the officials did come to Jeremiah, and they questioned him. He reported the exact words to them the king had commanded, and they quit speaking with him because the conversation   had not been overheard.

ngiemboon: Yelemî la cʉ́ʼ ńzso pɔ́ tetʉ́a papyɛ́b jʉʼ tà ńkú lyɛ̌ʼ gie pʉ̀a Mbambilonia la zyɛ́ʼ ńkúu tÿǒsoŋo Yelúzálèm.
en: Jeremiah remained in the guard’s courtyard until the day Jerusalem was captured, and he was there when it happened.
